Articles.Content:
One of my favorite movies. Watched it at a local AMC on the day it was released here.

Had the right moods at the right moments, too.

One of my favorite parts was when Benny, the mini-figure from a 1980's Space set, finally gets to build his spaceship and flies through everything super-happily and yelling "SPACESHIP!"
Better not watch this thread, haven't seen it yet

EVERYTHING IS AWESOME!!!! EVERYTHING IS AWESOME!!!! EVERYTHING IS AWESOME!!!! EVERYTHING IS AWESOME!!!! EVERYTHING IS AWESOME!!!! EVERYTHING IS AWESOME!!!!

The best move I've ever watched...well one of the best . That song is still stuck in my head. Yeah, and I love the spaceship guy, and how he was walking around a moon base in a clip hehe

Edited February 10, 2014 by mythbusters844
*Moon LOL

So the movie came out on my birthday and I was huge into Legos as a kid growing up in the late 70's and early 80's. The Lego space cruiser was one of my very first Lego space sets. Watching the movie brought back so many memories of playing with various sets over the years. I have to say I thoroughly enjoyed the movie. My girlfriend was even thrilled with it as well. I loved the kragle and the "piece of resistance" and how the movie ended. It was really pretty awesome. EVERYTHING IS AWESOME!

I really want to see this movie! Its ads on internet are the only ads that really convinced me to click on since a old advertisement of Combat Arms

Also LEGOs are the best toys i had when i was younger the last thing i did whit them was a Big Battleship, but the thing i always liked to do was Space fighters based on Starwars ones
I saw this movie, and have to say it is one of the best movies I've ever seen. To say I like Lego is an understatement, considering my basement looks like a Lego city got nuked into oblivion.
Seeing it this weekend possibly, sounds like the best movie since Despicable Me 2

To make a long story short: My favorite movie, ever.

To make a short story long: This movie triumphs over even my original favorite movie, Cloudy With a Chance Of Meatballs. Now people say, oh, Despicable Me 1/2 were the funniest movies. No, any part of this movie that wasn't a major plot point had a joke in it.

I saw it on Sunday, relatively hilarious, and reminded me of 2001: A Space Odyssey (It was the portal to infinite nothingness, that's why.)

And basically, here's my building speed compared to other members, using lego movie quotes.

OTHER PEOPLE: "Okay, racecar, uhhh....."

ME: "SPACESHIPSPACESHIPSPACESHIPSPACESHIP"
I should have know ksp people would be big lego fans....
I am still convinced that Benny (1980-something space guy) is an alternate universe equivalent of our very Jebediah Kerman.
The intro was a humerus kid's version of 1984.
I now drive my wife nuts by asking her "Where's my pants?"

The intro was a humerus kid's version of 1984.

Yeah, I noticed that too. Well, my brother told me that
Spaceship spaceship spaceship spaceship spaceship spaceship spaceship spaceship spaceship spaceship spaceship spaceship spaceship spaceship spaceship spaceship
